column4: hi, i have problems installing Ubuntu 6.06, 6.10 or the latest alpha 5. they all stall after i choose to install them, safe graphics mode doesnt help
i can't even find any install logs on any consoles
You probably need to pass a kernel boot option something like noacpi...
If you hit ESC when you're at the first menu you should be able to add it to the kernel line in grub.
Yeah ^^
Ah. Old machine? Maybe try burning the iso at a lower speed. See if another livecd loads?
acpi=off I thing.
Jowi If you're loading the livecd then hit ESC at the first menu...
Just happens with some install machines. Get it installed and update the kernel. Everything should be fine.
yes, but when i tried to install alpha 5 which has 2.6.20 (newest kernel) it didnt help anyways
i suspect it won't help, but i will try of course.
There are ways and means. Maybe your chipset needs some extra module or something that isn't in the base kernel.
oh ok, that makes sense. ok, thank you very much for help, going to play with kernel paramets after i read Documentation/ dir of course :)
Can't hurt it to run that option. Just usually is that one IMHO.
oh here you are :) i tried pci=noacpi and acpi=off and that didnt help :( i edited boot options while in the menu and pressing F6
Cool. That's a learning experience for you. :) F6 is it? Didn't know that...
yes, but that didnt help :(
i found out though, that it can't load live cd that's why it's failing probably
what to do now?
New machine/ Won't start the livecd/ What to do next?
i dont know?
Sorry it's a troubling one. It's a new machine so I'm certain you need to pass some boot parameter to stop it choking.
